summary: Run an externally hosted UDF container
description:
Runs a compatible UDF container that is either externally hosted by a service provider or running on a local machine of the user. The UDF container must follow the [openEO UDF specification](https://openeo.org/documentation/1.0/udfs.html).

The referenced UDF service can be executed in several processes such as ``aggregate_spatial()``, ``apply()``, ``apply_dimension()`` and ``reduce_dimension()``. In this case, an array is passed instead of a data cube. The user must ensure that the data is provided in a way that the UDF code can make sense of it.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description:
The data to be passed to the UDF.

Usually, `run_udf` process is used as a child process of a data cube process such as ``reduce_dimension()`` or ``apply()``. These data cube processes define the actual type of this data. For example, in case of ``reduce_dimension()``, `data` will be an array of values, while in case of ``apply()`` it will be a single scalar value.

schema.description: A value of any data type.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Absolute URL to a remote UDF service.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Additional data such as configuration options to be passed to the UDF.

returns.description: The data processed by the UDF. The returned value can in principle be of any data type, but it depends on what is returned by the UDF code. Please see the implemented UDF interface for details.
